qas.question: What automatic right do Australian citizens and residents have on Norfolk Island after meeting the criteria in Immigration (Amendment No. 2) Act 2012?
What do Australian citizens need in order to travel to Norfolk Island?

answers.text: either a passport or a Document of Identity

qas.question: What do citizens from other nations need in order to travel to Norfolk Island?
When someone has an Australian visa and they want to travel to Norfolk Island, where must they depart?
What will happen to travelers with an Australian visa who don't depart from the Australian Migration Zone?
What automatic right do Australian citizens and residents lose on Norfolk Island after meeting the criteria in Immigration (Amendment No. 2) Act 2012?

plausible_answers.text: either a passport or a Document of Identity

qas.question: What do Australian citizens need in order to talk about Norfolk Island?
What do citizens from other nations need in order to talk about Norfolk Island?
When someone has an American visa and they want to travel to Norfolk Island, where must they depart?
What will happen to travelers with an American visa who don't depart from the Australian Migration Zone?

context: Australian citizens and residents from other parts of the nation now have <a0_0><b5_0>automatic right of residence<b5_0/><a0_0/> on the island after meeting these criteria (Immigration (Amendment No. 2) Act 2012). Australian citizens must carry <a1_0><b6_0>either a passport or a Document of Identity<b6_0/><a1_0/> to travel to Norfolk Island. Citizens of all other nations must carry <a2_0><b7_0>a passport<b7_0/><a2_0/> to travel to Norfolk Island even if arriving from other parts of Australia. Holders of Australian visas who travel to Norfolk Island have departed the <a3_0><b8_0>Australian Migration Zone<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Unless they hold a multiple-entry visa, <a4_0><b9_0>the visa will have ceased<b9_0/><a4_0/>; in which case they will require another visa to re-enter mainland Australia.
